DOC.brief_summary: The low prevalence moderate-to-vigorous physical activity ( MVPA ) among adult Latinas likely contribute high rate cancer chronic disease population . The goal current study , base largely upon core principle Social Ecological Model , design , implement , evaluate innovative multi-level intervention promote physical activity among churchgoing Latinas . The evidenced-based intervention target three `` tier '' environmental influence ( i.e. , church , immediate neighborhood surround church , community ) activity , well MVPA-related personal factor ( i.e.. , intra/interpersonal , cultural , perceived environmental variable ) . The physical activity intervention compare attention-control condition provide health education cancer prevention control via screen . Sixteen church randomly assign either physical activity intervention attention-control condition . The primary aim study determine whether multi-level intervention increase MVPA among Latina churchgoer intervention condition relative attention-control condition .
